## Market figures

<iframe src="https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vQmO63SAvADly-33ZEakHkh4zufaSBLRMzuGF_3TIecNokBZztAHcpjlN4WoCsuEDQ9gfWHiqNJQE90/embed?start=false&loop=false&delayms=3000" frameborder="0" width="960" height="569" allowfullscreen="true" mozallowfullscreen="true" webkitallowfullscreen="true"></iframe>



**Current market**: The total number of customers, units, or revenue currently being generated in the market.

**Market penetration formula:** Calculates the percentage of customers in the potential market who are currently purchasing a product or service.

**Market segment:** A subset of the total current or potential customers in a market.

**Market share**: The percentage of the total demand that a company has captured in terms of units sold or gross revenue.

**Potential market:** The set of customers who have some interest in a product or service, or to whom the product is potentially relevant.
